result.execSummary:
The defendant James Henry Putchel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/21/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest. No living together without the approval of an Agent.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Henry Putchel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Henry Putchel in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Cheryl P.

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days concurrent in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest. No living together without the approval of an agent.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Cash bail to be applied. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
 
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.

Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Henry Putchel in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant has another case which is set in this court on 4/30/15.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
$650.00 bail to be returned.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for James Henry Putchel
Current: 2125 South 67th Place, West Allis, WI 53219   (Effective: 03-12-2015)
Prior: 2125 South 67th Place, West Allis, WI 53219
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cheryl P. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant James Henry Putchel in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/12/15 @ 1:30pm
